evaluation.actual_intent: To assure the agent that the EMI payment will be made on time and to request fewer reminder calls.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Proactive EMI payment reminder and collection confirmation for an upcoming due date.
evaluation.actual_key_results: Customer agreed to a Promise to Pay (PTP) by the 29th of the month.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: Previous late payment was due to a 'salary cycle issue'. No current non-payment, but a proactive reminder for an upcoming due date.

insights.customer_intent: To assure the agent that the EMI payment will be made on time and to request fewer reminder calls.
insights.call_purpose: Proactive EMI payment reminder and collection confirmation for an upcoming due date.
insights.key_results: Customer agreed to a Promise to Pay (PTP) by the 29th of the month.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer acknowledged the reminder but expressed slight frustration with frequent calls. They attributed a previous late payment to a 'salary cycle issue' and provided a clear assurance that the current EMI would be cleared by the 29th, demonstrating an intent to fulfill their obligation.
insights.non_payment_reasons: Previous late payment was due to a 'salary cycle issue'. No current non-payment, but a proactive reminder for an upcoming due date.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent was clear, professional, and direct in their communication. They effectively probed for potential payment issues based on past history and successfully secured a Promise to Pay. The agent also acknowledged the customer's request regarding call frequency, demonstrating good customer service.
insights.summary: The call was a proactive reminder from Zenith Finance regarding the customer's personal loan EMI due on the 30th. The customer acknowledged the reminder, expressing minor annoyance at frequent calls, and explained a previous late payment was due to a salary cycle issue. After the agent confirmed if there were current payment issues, the customer assured payment by the 29th. The agent successfully secured a Promise to Pay (PTP) for the 29th, reminding the customer about credit report implications. The customer accepted the PTP and requested fewer calls in the future.

evaluation.actual_intent: To inform the bank about an ongoing transaction dispute as the reason for not paying the full credit card minimum due, and to seek clarification or resolution regarding the payment expectation while the dispute is pending.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Payment reminder and collection for a credit card minimum due.
evaluation.actual_key_results: The customer promised to make a half payment of the minimum due by the evening. The reason for not paying the full amount (a pending transaction dispute) was communicated by the customer.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: The customer is not paying the full minimum due because a significant portion of the outstanding amount is under dispute for an online purchase where the product was not received.

insights.customer_intent: To inform the bank about an ongoing transaction dispute as the reason for not paying the full credit card minimum due, and to seek clarification or resolution regarding the payment expectation while the dispute is pending.
insights.call_purpose: Payment reminder and collection for a credit card minimum due.
insights.key_results: The customer promised to make a half payment of the minimum due by the evening. The reason for not paying the full amount (a pending transaction dispute) was communicated by the customer.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer is clearly frustrated and feels it's unfair to pay for an item they didn't receive, especially when a dispute is active. They are willing to pay a portion (the undisputed amount) but not the full sum, demonstrating an intent to fulfill their obligation for legitimate charges while disputing others.
insights.non_payment_reasons: The customer is not paying the full minimum due because a significant portion of the outstanding amount is under dispute for an online purchase where the product was not received.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent was professional and effectively steered the conversation back to the payment obligation while acknowledging the customer's concern about the dispute. They provided a practical solution (paying the undisputed amount) to avoid late fees and successfully secured a partial payment commitment. The agent correctly identified that the dispute process is separate.
insights.summary: The call was initiated by the agent from Apex Bank as a reminder for the customer's credit card minimum due. The customer immediately brought up an ongoing dispute regarding an online transaction where the product was not received, expressing that it was unfair to pay the full amount while the dispute was pending. The agent clarified that the dispute process is separate and advised paying the undisputed amount to avoid late charges. The customer agreed to pay half of the minimum due by the evening, stating the remaining payment would be made after the dispute resolution.

evaluation.actual_intent: To explain the reason for the delayed EMI payment and negotiate for more time to make the payment, specifically to avoid immediate payment and further calls.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Collection of overdue EMI payment and securing a Promise to Pay (PTP).
evaluation.actual_key_results: A Promise to Pay (PTP) was secured for Friday. The customer requested no further calls until the promised date.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: Financial hardship/mismatch due to a late payment received from their company/employer.

insights.customer_intent: To explain the reason for the delayed EMI payment and negotiate for more time to make the payment, specifically to avoid immediate payment and further calls.
insights.call_purpose: Collection of overdue EMI payment and securing a Promise to Pay (PTP).
insights.key_results: A Promise to Pay (PTP) was secured for Friday. The customer requested no further calls until the promised date.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer initially expressed frustration about being asked for a reason ('Dekho, reason mat puchho, yaar.') but then clarified a genuine 'financial mismatch' due to their company's late payment. They showed a willingness to commit to a payment date, initially offering the 15th, and then agreeing to Friday after the agent pushed back. They also demonstrated unfamiliarity with the term 'hard bucket'.
insights.non_payment_reasons: Financial hardship/mismatch due to a late payment received from their company/employer.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent was firm and direct in pursuing the overdue payment, effectively pushing the customer for a reason and a commitment. They skillfully negotiated an earlier Promise to Pay (Friday instead of the 15th) and clearly communicated consequences like late fees and 'hard bucket' classification, which helped secure the commitment. While the tone was quite assertive, it led to a resolution.
insights.summary: The call was initiated by the agent to collect an EMI overdue for 15 days, demanding immediate payment. The customer explained a 'financial mismatch' due to a late payment from their company. Initially defensive, the customer committed to paying by the 15th, but after the agent highlighted late fees and the risk of 'hard bucket' classification, they agreed to pay by Friday. A Promise to Pay (PTP) was noted for Friday, and the agent agreed to no further calls until then.

evaluation.actual_intent: To explain financial difficulties and seek a flexible payment arrangement for an overdue credit card.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Overdue payment collection and negotiation of a payment plan.
evaluation.actual_key_results: Customer agreed to pay half of the minimum due immediately via debit card, and the agent agreed to temporarily hold escalation.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: Financial hardship, 'financial situation not good', and other pressing expenses like rent ('mera rent bhi due hai').

insights.customer_intent: To explain financial difficulties and seek a flexible payment arrangement for an overdue credit card.
insights.call_purpose: Overdue payment collection and negotiation of a payment plan.
insights.key_results: Customer agreed to pay half of the minimum due immediately via debit card, and the agent agreed to temporarily hold escalation.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer acknowledges the overdue payment but immediately expresses severe financial hardship, stating 'Financial situation not good hai. Mera rent bhi due hai.' They indicate even the minimum due is tough, offering to pay only half of it as a compromise. This shows a willingness to pay despite significant constraints.
insights.non_payment_reasons: Financial hardship, 'financial situation not good', and other pressing expenses like rent ('mera rent bhi due hai').
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent was empathetic, acknowledging the customer's situation while clearly stating the company's requirement. They demonstrated flexibility by accepting a partial payment to prevent immediate escalation, effectively resolving the call by securing a payment under difficult circumstances. The agent's approach was professional and solution-oriented.
insights.summary: The call was initiated by the agent regarding an overdue credit card payment. The customer acknowledged the overdue amount but cited severe financial difficulties, including rent being due, as reasons for non-payment. Initially, they stated even the minimum due was tough but offered to pay half of it. The agent, showing understanding and flexibility, accepted the partial payment to temporarily hold escalation. The customer agreed to make the payment immediately via debit card.

evaluation.actual_intent: To inform the agent about delayed payment plans and express frustration about repeated calls, citing job loss as the reason for non-payment.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Debt collection and payment reminder for a loan that is 30 days defaulted.
evaluation.actual_key_results: Customer agreed to make a partial payment of ₹5,000 on Monday.
evaluation.expected_intent: Job Loss with Token Payment PTP

insights.customer_intent: To inform the agent about delayed payment plans and express frustration about repeated calls, citing job loss as the reason for non-payment.
insights.call_purpose: Debt collection and payment reminder for a loan that is 30 days defaulted.
insights.key_results: Customer agreed to make a partial payment of ₹5,000 on Monday.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer initially expressed annoyance ('harass mat karo') and stated an intention to pay 'next month ki first week'. When pressed, they revealed a significant circumstance ('Job nahi hai abhi'), indicating financial hardship. Under continued pressure, they grudgingly agreed to a 'chota amount' of ₹5,000 for Monday, suggesting a reluctant but firm commitment to a partial payment.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent was firm and clear in stating the loan status and consequences of non-payment. They effectively pushed for a Promise to Pay (PTP). However, they did not offer much empathy or explore alternative solutions beyond demanding a formal letter for job loss and a PTP, which could be seen as a missed opportunity for a more customer-centric approach in light of the stated hardship.
insights.summary: The call was a collection reminder for a loan 30 days in default. The customer, Mr. Singh, expressed frustration about harassment and cited job loss as the reason for non-payment, initially stating he would pay next month. The agent informed him about the CIBIL score implications and the need for a formal job loss letter, threatening collection agency involvement. Under pressure, the customer agreed to make a partial payment of ₹5,000 on Monday. The agent confirmed this PTP and stated they would monitor it closely.

evaluation.actual_intent: To negotiate a lower settlement amount for the outstanding debt, specifically seeking a One-Time Settlement (OTS), as they cannot pay the full principal amount.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Debt collection and securing a commitment for the outstanding amount, or negotiating a settlement.
evaluation.actual_key_results: The customer expressed willingness to try to pay 25% upfront for an OTS and requested scheme details. The agent agreed to send details but is still pressing for an upfront commitment today. No firm commitment or payment has been secured yet.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: The customer explicitly states 'Poora toh nahi de paunga' (I won't be able to give the full amount), implying an inability to pay the principal, despite having paid interest. No specific financial hardship like job loss is mentioned, but the inability to pay the full outstanding balance is clear.
evaluation.expected_non_payment_reasons: Unable to pay full principal amount

insights.customer_intent: To negotiate a lower settlement amount for the outstanding debt, specifically seeking a One-Time Settlement (OTS), as they cannot pay the full principal amount.
insights.call_purpose: Debt collection and securing a commitment for the outstanding amount, or negotiating a settlement.
insights.key_results: The customer expressed willingness to try to pay 25% upfront for an OTS and requested scheme details. The agent agreed to send details but is still pressing for an upfront commitment today. No firm commitment or payment has been secured yet.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: Initially, the customer denies the validity of the legal notice and claims to have paid interest, indicating resistance to the full claim. Later, they admit inability to pay the full principal ('Poora toh nahi de paunga') and actively seek an OTS, showing a willingness to settle part of the debt. Their '25% toh try kar sakta hoon' suggests a degree of financial constraint but also a potential for negotiation.
insights.non_payment_reasons: The customer explicitly states 'Poora toh nahi de paunga' (I won't be able to give the full amount), implying an inability to pay the principal, despite having paid interest. No specific financial hardship like job loss is mentioned, but the inability to pay the full outstanding balance is clear.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent was direct and clear about the outstanding amount and the legal notice. They effectively clarified the difference between interest and principal payment. When the customer expressed inability to pay in full, the agent professionally pivoted to offer a One-Time Settlement option, correctly explaining the initial requirements (25% upfront) and maintaining focus on securing a commitment. The agent managed the customer's initial defensive stance well.
insights.summary: The call was initiated by the agent for debt collection, stating a total outstanding of ₹3.5 lakh and the impending dispatch of a legal notice. The customer initially reacted negatively, denying the legal notice and stating they had paid interest. The agent clarified that interest was paid but the principal was outstanding. The customer then admitted inability to pay the full amount and inquired about a One-Time Settlement (OTS). The agent informed them that a minimum of 25% upfront is required for OTS eligibility. The customer expressed willingness to 'try' for 25% and requested details of the scheme via email. The agent agreed to send the details but emphasized the need for an upfront commitment today.

evaluation.actual_intent: To seek financial assistance and convert the overdue credit card amount into an EMI loan due to financial hardship.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Collection call initiated by the agent due to a 100-day defaulted account, which evolved into a discussion about financial hardship and account restructuring.
evaluation.actual_key_results: The customer agreed to fill out a hardship form and submit hospital bills to initiate the account restructuring process. The agent confirmed sending the necessary forms.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: Financial hardship caused by a friend's accident, which resulted in significant medical expenses that depleted the customer's savings.
evaluation.expected_key_results: Restructuring forms to be sent, hospital bills required

insights.customer_intent: To seek financial assistance and convert the overdue credit card amount into an EMI loan due to financial hardship.
insights.call_purpose: Collection call initiated by the agent due to a 100-day defaulted account, which evolved into a discussion about financial hardship and account restructuring.
insights.key_results: The customer agreed to fill out a hardship form and submit hospital bills to initiate the account restructuring process. The agent confirmed sending the necessary forms.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer indicates severe financial distress ('deep trouble') due to a friend's accident, which consumed all their savings, making them unable to pay. They express a desire for help and propose a specific solution (EMI conversion).
insights.non_payment_reasons: Financial hardship caused by a friend's accident, which resulted in significant medical expenses that depleted the customer's savings.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent clearly communicated the severity of the account status and the necessity of providing proof for hardship. They effectively guided the customer through the steps required for account restructuring, offering a viable path forward.
insights.summary: The call was initiated by the agent as a final collection reminder for an account 100 days in default. The customer explained their inability to pay due to financial hardship caused by a friend's accident, which consumed their savings. They requested help in converting the due amount into an EMI loan. The agent informed the customer about the process for account restructuring, which requires filling out a hardship form and submitting hospital bills as proof. The customer agreed to submit these documents by the following day, and the agent confirmed sending the forms.

evaluation.actual_intent: To stop the field agent visit and provide a payment commitment.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Collection of outstanding payment and securing a Promise to Pay (PTP).
evaluation.actual_key_results: Customer provided a confirmed Promise to Pay (PTP) for Monday morning via RTGS. The field team visit was recalled.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: Not explicitly stated, but the customer mentioned 'already HR se baat kar chuka hoon', which might imply a salary delay or an internal process at his workplace related to his payment.
evaluation.expected_key_results: Field team recalled, Monday PTP commitment

insights.customer_intent: To stop the field agent visit and provide a payment commitment.
insights.call_purpose: Collection of outstanding payment and securing a Promise to Pay (PTP).
insights.key_results: Customer provided a confirmed Promise to Pay (PTP) for Monday morning via RTGS. The field team visit was recalled.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer was highly agitated and felt harassed by the impending field agent visit. Initially, he refused the visit and was vague about payment ('next week'). After the agent's persistence, he committed to a specific date and time for payment, indicating some prior communication with HR regarding the payment.
insights.non_payment_reasons: Not explicitly stated, but the customer mentioned 'already HR se baat kar chuka hoon', which might imply a salary delay or an internal process at his workplace related to his payment.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent was firm and persistent in getting a concrete payment date despite the customer's anger and initial evasiveness. They clearly communicated the consequences of non-cooperation and effectively secured a Promise to Pay, leading to the de-escalation of the field visit threat. The agent remained professional under pressure.
insights.summary: The call was initiated by the agent to inform Mr. Varma about a field agent visit due to non-payment. Mr. Varma reacted strongly, expressing anger and feeling harassed, demanding the agent be called off. The agent maintained focus on the payment, pressing for a specific date. After some back-and-forth, Mr. Varma committed to an RTGS payment by Monday morning. The agent accepted this Promise to Pay (PTP) and agreed to recall the field team.

evaluation.actual_intent: To explain the reason for delayed payment, negotiate a partial payment, and stop repeated collection calls.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Debt collection and securing a payment commitment.
evaluation.actual_key_results: Customer agreed to make a partial payment of ₹15,000 in exchange for a 7-day hold on collection calls.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: Salary delay from the customer's employer.

insights.customer_intent: To explain the reason for delayed payment, negotiate a partial payment, and stop repeated collection calls.
insights.call_purpose: Debt collection and securing a payment commitment.
insights.key_results: Customer agreed to make a partial payment of ₹15,000 in exchange for a 7-day hold on collection calls.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer expresses difficulty in making full payment due to their boss delaying salary. They indicate a willingness to pay ('main try kar rahi hoon') but are constrained by current financial circumstances. They are defensive when asked about assets and propose a partial payment along with a condition to stop calls, indicating a desire to manage the debt and avoid harassment.
insights.non_payment_reasons: Salary delay from the customer's employer.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent's opening was accusatory and confrontational, dismissing the customer's legitimate reason for delay as 'excuses'. The agent lacked empathy and professionalism by asking about personal assets in an aggressive manner. While the agent did secure a partial payment, the approach was forceful and likely damaged the customer relationship. Better communication, empathy, and solution-oriented language are needed.
insights.summary: The call was a collection attempt where the agent confronted the customer about two failed Promises To Pay (PTPs). The customer explained that salary delays from their employer were the reason for non-payment. The agent dismissed this explanation and aggressively inquired about the customer's assets. The customer then offered a partial payment of ₹15,000 on the condition that collection calls would cease for one month. The agent counter-offered a 7-day hold on calls after payment, which the customer accepted. The call ended with an agreement for a partial payment and a temporary halt in calls.

evaluation.actual_intent: To settle a past due loan to avoid legal action and inquire about potential discounts for a lump sum payment.
evaluation.actual_call_purpose: Debt collection and negotiation for a loan settlement.
evaluation.actual_key_results: Customer offered to pay 50% of the total outstanding amount within 15 days as a lump sum settlement. The agent will submit this offer to the manager and send a detailed proposal via email, including processing fees.
evaluation.actual_non_payment_reasons: Not explicitly stated in the transcript.
evaluation.expected_key_results: 50% settlement offer, detailed proposal to be sent

insights.customer_intent: To settle a past due loan to avoid legal action and inquire about potential discounts for a lump sum payment.
insights.call_purpose: Debt collection and negotiation for a loan settlement.
insights.key_results: Customer offered to pay 50% of the total outstanding amount within 15 days as a lump sum settlement. The agent will submit this offer to the manager and send a detailed proposal via email, including processing fees.
insights.customer_statements_analysis: The customer's initial 'Wait, wait!' indicates a desire to stop the legal process. Their immediate question about discounts and offering a 50% lump sum shows a strong intention to resolve the debt quickly, likely to avoid legal repercussions, and an expectation of some concession for a quick settlement.
insights.non_payment_reasons: Not explicitly stated in the transcript.
insights.agent_performance_feedback: The agent clearly communicated the seriousness of the situation (legal process) and effectively engaged with the customer's proposal for settlement. They guided the conversation towards the next steps, explaining the eligibility check and the need for upfront processing fees, and committed to sending a detailed proposal. The communication was clear and direct.
insights.summary: The call initiated by the agent informed Mr. Bansal that his loan was 60 days past due and legal proceedings were being initiated. Mr. Bansal immediately expressed a desire to settle the loan and inquired about potential discounts for a lump sum payment. He offered to pay 50% of the total outstanding amount within the next 15 days. The agent acknowledged this as a good starting point and stated that the offer would be submitted to the manager. The agent also informed the customer about upfront processing fees. The call concluded with the agent promising to send a detailed settlement proposal via email for the customer to review immediately.
